comments: This course covers the basic ideas of probability theory. Topics covered include combinatorics, random variables, functions of random variables, means, moments, and generating functions.   Students felt the material covered in this class is “essential” but the assignments were unrelated to the lectures. Lectures were described as “boring” “slow” and “not that interesting.”   Prof. Pappas was described by students as “a bit dry,” but many felt that he “does a good job explaining the underlying concepts.” Students generally wished that the professor had made himself more accessible to students after class.   Students found the lectures to be “quite easy” but some felt that the homework sets were “ridiculously hard to do and took forever.” Overall, students wished that the lectures had been more applicable to the assignments and exams. This course, which can be substituted with STAT430, is a required course for many engineering majors.
